p: All ewes lambed over a 10-day period in mid-March, and within each farm were managed together for the duration of the study. On Farm 2, monitored ewes were all of similar age (2 or 3â€¯years), and gave birth to twins (with the exception of one triplet-bearing ewe). This restriction was intended to reduce variation in FEC due to, inter alia, unequal resource allocation trade-offs among ewes feeding different numbers of lambs, which could modify the expression of immunity and hence FEC during the PPR ( Coop and Kyriazakis, 1999). Equivalent restriction was not possible on Farm 1 due to limited numbers of ewes. On both farms, ewes and lambs grazed ad libitum on pasture composed primarily of Lolium perenne (perennial ryegrass) . No supplementary feed was given.
